feed.title: AO3 - Clark Kent/Bruce Wayne (Filtered)
feed.subtitle: Latest works for Clark Kent/Bruce Wayne on Archive of Our Own [English, No ABO]

entry.title: To be apart of Something
entry.summary:
Author: Norbit2plan3t

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,118Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 392

Summary: “Fine,” he whispered, his voice low and cold. “If I’m so impossible, so difficult, then I’ll leave.” He threw the bag over his shoulder and stepped to the window. The night air was crisp as he pushed it open, the cool breeze brushing against his face. He hesitated, just for a moment.A part of him wondered if anyone would even notice. Jason’s words echoed one final time. "No one is coming for you." Then again. "No one loves you." With a steady breath, Damian stepped onto the ledge. He didn’t look back. His mother had made it clear, he wasn’t meant to need anyone. To want anyone. Dependency was weakness. However, Manor, it was different. Or it was supposed to be anyway. And then he was gone, vanishing into the night like a shadow slipping between the cracks.

entry.title: The Buttered Cat Paradox
entry.summary:
Author: writersagainstwritersblock

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,972Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 196

Summary: “No comment.”“You don’t know what I was going to ask,” Clark said with a hint of a smile. “Maybe I just wanted to congratulate you on catching the Film Freak.”Bruce gave him a flat look.“Or maybe I think I can help.”“With a case of vandalism?”Clark stepped in front of him. “It’s not vandalism and you know it, detective.”“And what makes you say that?”“If it were vandalism it would be something a lot more juvenile. To the point. It wouldn’t claim there were seventeen missing kids. That’s public outcry.”“Is that so?”“That and I tried to do a story on the growing number of homeless children last month and I got shut down. According to the last count, the numbers have been decreasing, but there’s been no change in policies, no extra funding to CPS, or shelters, or even an increase in the number of inmates in the juvenile detention center. So where are they going?” Detective Bruce Wayne may have the highest solve rate in Gotham, but if he wants to solve this case, he’ll need the help of an elusive street kid, and while Dick Grayson always lands on his feet, he usually lands himself right into trouble.

entry.title: Assess and Plan
entry.summary:
Author: mustangisinflames

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,461Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 19

Summary: "Batman was stronger than most but clearly not strong enough: failure recognised, accepted, compartmentalised. Now to step back, reassess, figure out a compensation to work in his favour. He needed an even playing field, something that could reduce a near-god to a mortal - he hesitated to say man, because that was exactly what Superman wasn’t. He was an alien seemingly seeking asylum on Earth, playing pretend as humanity’s protector. There had to be an angle, a hidden agenda, even if Batman couldn’t quite see it currently.Kryptonite. The answer clearly lay there." Batman's concerns are raised after his first interaction with Superman.

entry.title: Like Cats and Dogs
entry.summary:
Author: bajuwa

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 77,635Chapters: 31/32Kudos: 1,985

Summary: In a world where soulmates are represented by animal familiars, Clark wonders if his soulmate is a cat. A literal domesticated feline animal that one could get from the pet store and not just a person with some cat-like personality traits. There’s no other explanation as to why his familiar acts like every single asshole cat meme to ever exist.On the off chance his soulmate is a real human being, well… He would never tell his mother this, she raised him too well, but sometimes Clark wishes his soulmate’s familiar was making him feel just as miserable.---Bruce peels his eyes away from the monitors to look down at the menace on his lap and barely contains a look of disgust. Big blue eyes stare up at him as he rests his chin on Bruce’s thigh, and as their eyes meet, the pathetic, whimpering little whines are replaced by excited huffs, the clickity clack of dancing paws on concrete, and the rhythmic thumping of his tail hitting the leg of the table.Why does it have to be so needy and cuddly all the time?(new chapters every Tuesday and Friday!)

entry.title: Bruce Wayne and the Secret of Wizardry
entry.summary:
Author: Darknight2020

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,799Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 19

Summary: “Bruce Wayne is not just a semi-normal Hogwarts student, Clark noticed. He was definitely hiding something or he’s too suspicious to be anything but normal! It all lined up in Clark’s mind — his disappearances in the night, his unusual ability at being good at things that a regular student should not be, the rumours of him blowing up stuff (and sometimes actually being on the verge of), his literal age is something that school and students should be concerned about, for sure!…yet Clark every time proves himself slightly more wrong than before.The Guy of a Year is definitely someone who makes him float in middle of a night in restricted section of Library’s ceiling, while holding aforementioned Guy to not let them both fall on the poor Mr. Filch and his cat.”_______________________________________OR Harry Potter Au!Superbat fic with some detective and drama shit that for some reason nobody wrote?

entry.title: Tentacles of Love
entry.summary:
Author: LadyArkin

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,735Chapters: 5/10Kudos: 54

Summary: He wasn’t even offering much more than, “I need a favor, buddy.”Batman’s marriage proposal was sudden and…strategic.Once they’ve spent some time together, Batman talks Superman into marrying for a mission. A mission that Bruce declares to be entirely selfish which he needs for business purposes. This mission isn’t supposed to be impactful to either of their personal lives.It starts when Bruce releases pictures of Batman proposing to Superman. He didn’t need more than a distraction and if it hadn’t been for an intervention from their family and friends, it wouldn’t have been. The more involved their blended family gets into their relationship, the more that they are supported in their relationship.
